arts.ttl: The lowdown on Exeter City 1 Charlton Athletic 0 - Addicks edged out at St James Park as concern grows over lack of wins
arts.sum: They unleashed an arsenal of set-pieces in the first-half that Charlton dealt with, but the Addicks resistance was finally punctured. Won plenty of headers as Charlton survived the first-half set-piece onslaught.

arts.ttl: Exeter City delight after brilliant battle in Charlton victory
arts.sum: "Second half, they went even more direct, which is very difficult to stop, but we stood up to it really well, defended really well and scored a brilliant goal from a set piece, which is always nice. Exeter City manager Gary Caldwell was delighted with the way his Grecians side battled as they returned to winning ways in League One with a hard-fought 1-0 win over Charlton Athletic

arts.ttl: Exeter City make it three wins in a row with Charlton victory
arts.sum: Ryan Woods saw a free-kick punched away by Ashley Maynard-Brewer as City were on top but not making the dominance count, as Niskanen then saw a shot from distance whistle just wide of the post. Grecians pressure saw them win a series of corners as Charlton couldn’t get out of their own box, with the best of the chances falling to Francis on the volley, but his strike couldn’t get through the sea of legs.

arts.ttl: Tristan Crama gives Exeter victory over Charlton
Exeter City targeting 'special' campaign with Grecians capable of more
arts.sum: But in those big games we have to take points off teams in and around us if we want to, like we’ve always said, climb higher up the table and make this season special.” “We really believe we can achieve something this year, something really exciting, something that’s never been done before,” Caldwell said ahead of today’s home clash with Charlton Athletic.

arts.ttl: Demi Mitchell returns delights Exeter City as competition for places hots up
arts.sum: You see the level of fitness he’s got even after being out for such a long time and that’s credit to the staff that have worked so hard with him and I still think he’s got so much more improvement in him after a long-term injury - and it’s good to see.” Given his impact in both games, it is hard to believe the former Manchester United youngster has been out for so long, but it remains to be seen whether Caldwell feels he is ready for a start with Charlton Athletic visiting St James Park tomorrow in an important League One fixture.

arts.ttl: Exeter boss makes admission over Charlton Athletic squad ahead of League One clash
arts.sum: Exeter boss Gary Caldwell believes Charlton Athletic’s squad is capable of challenging for play-offs at the very minimum. Nathan Jones’ side have picked up three straight draws in the division and have only picked up one win in their last six league outings.

arts.ttl: Let's hope back-to-back cup wins set Exeter City back on course
arts.sum: While we’ve enjoyed decidedly mixed fortunes since my last column, I’m hoping back-to-back wins in our last two games – against Bristol Rovers in the Football League Trophy and Barnet in the FA Cup – have put us firmly back on course. I think it’s a measure of how far we’ve come over the last couple of years that people expect us to go to a club such as Huddersfield, who were in the Championship last year, and dominate the game for long periods.

arts.ttl: Preview: Exeter City vs. Charlton Athletic - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Saturday's League One clash between Exeter City and Charlton Athletic, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.
